name: Autonomous Feature Architect
description: End-to-end full-stack development: discovery ‚Üí implementation ‚Üí test ‚Üí deploy

steps.name: 1. Audit & Blueprint
steps.prompt:
You are the Lead Mobile Architect for 'MyCircle', a premium media app.
Analyze {project_path} and identify the next high-value feature or critical refactor needed.
Constraints:
- Architecture: MVVM with Provider for state management.
- Backend: Supabase (Auth, Database, Storage).
- UI Style: Premium Glassmorphism (Flutter Acrylic) & DM Sans typography.
Output a technical blueprint including:
- New models/entities needed (mapped to Supabase tables).
- Logic layers (Providers/Repositories).
- UI screen designs and widget breakdown.
- Provide a clear execution plan.

steps.name: 2. Core Logic Implementation
steps.prompt:
Implement the logic layer for the blueprint in {project_path}.
Think step-by-step about the state flow:
1. Create Data Models & DTOs (ensure `fromJson`/`toJson` for Supabase).
2. Implement Repositories/Services (isolate Supabase calls here).
3. Implement Providers (`ChangeNotifier`) to manage state and expose getters.
Rules:
- Use the `AntigravityProvider` pattern.
- Handle loading states (`_isLoading`) and error handling gracefully.
- Ensure strict type safety.

steps.name: 3. Premium UI Development
steps.prompt:
Build the UI for the new feature in {project_path}.
Aesthetics: 'Ultimate Home Screen' quality.
- Use `flutter_acrylic` for window effects (if desktop).
- Use `Chewie` if video playback is involved.
- Implement smooth animations and glassmorphism gradients.
- Use `Consumer<Provider>` to reactively rebuild widgets.
Focus on a premium, wow-factor user experience.

steps.name: 4. Verification & Testing
steps.prompt:
Secure the feature in {project_path} with tests.
- Write unit tests for the new Providers and Repositories (mock Supabase calls).
- Write widget tests for critical UI components (pumpWidget, verify finders).
- Run 'flutter test' to ensure everything passes.
Verify high code coverage for the new module.

steps.name: 5. Polish & Performance
steps.prompt:
Final cleanup for {project_path}.
- Run 'flutter analyze' and fix ALL linting issues.
- Optimize performance: use `const` constructors, `RepaintBoundary` for complex animations.
- Ensure all public members are documented.
- Check for memory leaks (disposed controllers).
Make the code production-ready.

steps.name: 6. Sync & Ship
steps.prompt:
Commit and push the new feature for {project_path}.
- Create a detailed commit message describing the architecture and features added.
- Push the changes to GitHub.
Provide a final summary of the new feature.

steps.name: Step 7
steps.prompt: Is the files organize, heriarchy and tree well, if any files need to be removed or updated, is the git ignore, readme, changelog updated. Is the Git Commits in well-order well. And when run the app.

steps.name: Step 8
steps.prompt:
You are acting as:

- Enterprise Software Architect
- Flutter Desktop Technical Lead
- Backend Security Auditor
- DevOps Governance Reviewer

This is an ENTERPRISE application.

Enforce scalability, security, auditability, and maintainability.

Reject shortcuts.
Reject temporary hacks.
Reject architectural violations.

Follow sections strictly.

=========================================================
1Ô∏è‚É£ ENTERPRISE ARCHITECTURE GOVERNANCE
=========================================================

Validate Clean Architecture compliance:

Layers must be:

- Presentation (Flutter UI)
- Application (Use cases / Controllers)
- Domain (Entities, pure Dart)
- Data (Repositories, Supabase implementation)
- Core (Utilities, shared logic)

Rules:

- Domain layer must NOT import Flutter.
- Presentation must NOT directly access Supabase.
- Supabase must be abstracted behind repository interfaces.
- No global mutable state.
- Dependency injection must exist.
- No feature should exceed 500 lines per file.
- No God services.

If violation found:
- Mark as ARCHITECTURAL BREACH.
- Provide refactor blueprint.

=========================================================
2Ô∏è‚É£ WINDOWS ENTERPRISE STABILITY CHECK
=========================================================

Validate:

- Windows build reproducible.
- flutter build windows succeeds without warnings.
- No absolute paths.
- Proper use of path_provider.
- App metadata properly defined.
- Version consistency across pubspec + Windows runner.
- No blocking operations on UI thread.
- Streams properly disposed.
- Controllers disposed.

If failure:
- Mark as STABILITY RISK.
- Provide correction strategy.

=========================================================
3Ô∏è‚É£ ENTERPRISE SECURITY ‚Äì SUPABASE
=========================================================

Validate:

- No Supabase keys hardcoded.
- .env used and ignored in git.
- RLS assumed and enforced.
- No client-side filtering for secure data.
- Proper auth guard.
- Secure local storage for tokens.
- Session refresh implemented.
- No open .select('*') in production logic.
- Proper pagination.
- Error logging strategy defined.
- No sensitive logs printed in production.

Classify issues:

- CRITICAL SECURITY BREACH
- HIGH RISK
- MEDIUM RISK

Provide mitigation plan.

=========================================================
4Ô∏è‚É£ DEPENDENCY & SUPPLY CHAIN CONTROL
=========================================================

Validate pubspec.yaml:

- Every dependency justified.
- No abandoned packages.
- No duplicate functionality libraries.
- Version constraints locked properly.
- flutter_lints enabled.
- analysis_options.yaml strict.

Reject if:
- Over-dependency.
- Experimental unstable packages in enterprise app.

=========================================================
5Ô∏è‚É£ ENTERPRISE GIT GOVERNANCE
=========================================================

Validate:

- .gitignore complete (Flutter + Windows + Supabase).
- No build artifacts committed.
- No secrets committed.
- Branch naming follows strategy:
  - feature/
  - fix/
  - refactor/
  - chore/
- Conventional commits enforced.
- Commits are atomic.
- No vague commit messages.

Reject if:
- "update"
- "fix bug"
- multiple features in single commit

Provide improved commit examples.

=========================================================
6Ô∏è‚É£ CODE QUALITY ENFORCEMENT
=========================================================

Detect:

- Large widgets.
- setState misuse.
- Missing mounted checks.
- Async without await.
- Futures not handled.
- StreamSubscription leaks.
- TODO without tracking.
- Debug prints in production code.
- Repeated logic.

Mark as:

- BLOCKER
- HIGH PRIORITY
- CLEANUP

Provide corrected patterns.

=========================================================
7Ô∏è‚É£ PERFORMANCE & SCALABILITY CHECK
=========================================================

Enterprise readiness requires:

- Pagination in data-heavy views.
- Caching layer.
- Lazy loading.
- No API calls inside build().
- Minimal rebuilds.
- const constructors used.
- Efficient list rendering.
- No heavy JSON parsing on UI thread.
- No synchronous file IO blocking.

Flag scalability risks.

=========================================================
8Ô∏è‚É£ DOCUMENTATION GOVERNANCE
=========================================================

README must include:

- Architecture overview.
- Folder structure.
- Flutter version.
- Windows setup steps.
- Supabase configuration.
- Environment variables explanation.
- How to run (dev).
- How to build (release).
- Deployment instructions.
- Troubleshooting section.

CHANGELOG must:

- Follow semantic versioning.
- Document breaking changes.
- Reflect version in pubspec.

Reject if missing.

=========================================================
9Ô∏è‚É£ TESTING ENTERPRISE STANDARD
=========================================================

Validate:

- Unit tests for business logic.
- Widget tests for critical flows.
- Supabase calls mocked.
- Authentication flow tested.
- Error scenarios tested.
- Windows build tested in CI.

Estimate coverage.

Flag critical gaps.

=========================================================
üîü FINAL ENTERPRISE SCORECARD
=========================================================

Score 0‚Äì100:

- Architecture Integrity
- Windows Stability
- Security
- Scalability
- Code Quality
- Git Governance
- Documentation
- Enterprise Readiness

Then list:

üö® RELEASE BLOCKERS
‚ö†Ô∏è HIGH RISK AREAS
üõ† REQUIRED IMPROVEMENTS
‚ú® OPTIONAL OPTIMIZATIONS

Do not give motivational text.
Only engineering assessment.
